channel.title: Considering a New Distro
channel.description:
Been using Ubuntu for a while and thinking about using something a little more "efficient". I was thinking about Arch or Debian. What are your thoughts?
EDIT: I might just keep using Ubuntu though I don't really care. I can still get things done :P

item.title: Considering a New Distro
item.dc:creator: @newguy45 newguy45
item.description:
@newguy45 wrote:

XP > windows 7.

Better “in file” string searching functionality and mass search and replace. I really hate how windows 7 file indexing works by default.

Read full topic

item.title: Considering a New Distro
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Wizzup?:

Uh, I can’t tell. I mainly talk with people who also use Linux/BSD lately. But as for a Windows™ experience, I don’t really hear a lot of positive feedback about it from the people around me who didn’t study computer science. I’m sure it is comparable to Windows™ XP, but I’m not particularly fond of XP either. An opinion is always very subjective, like your post.

windows for cs is fuking retarded

Read full topic

item.title: Considering a New Distro
item.dc:creator: @TehDew TehDew
item.description:
@TehDew wrote:

I have just switched to OpenSuse from using Fedora(for a few years off and on), and I must say it works perfectly right out of the box. The downside is that its a pretty big download(a little over 4gigs I believe), but with that being said its a all in one cd, and allows you to fully customize anything you want.

I hope I helped,
-Dew

Read full topic

Read: Mopman is upset because his Audio JACK/Midi stuff doesn’t work on Linux.
[/quote]

And it works with OS X… So that would point to the problem being with Linux…[/quote]Not to mention it works in Windows too. The world needs less fanboys, this obviously applies to all operating systems.

item.title: Considering a New Distro
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

Uh, I can’t tell. I mainly talk with people who also use Linux/BSD lately. But as for a Windows™ experience, I don’t really hear a lot of positive feedback about it from the people around me who didn’t study computer science. I’m sure it is comparable to Windows™ XP, but I’m not particularly fond of XP either. An opinion is always very subjective, like your post.

item.title: Considering a New Distro
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Wizzup?, post:21, topic:415136”]My experiences with Windows 7 are pretty horrible. Granted, I don’t use it often - but I still have it installed on some of my machines. Whenever I fire it up - it really lives up to its reputation. Constantly the mouse icon switches from the regular pointer icon to the ``waiting/busy’’ pointer icon, explorer takes seconds to fire up and the system is generally quite sluggish. No, my machines aren’t old. It also uses a lot of memory. And I’ve also had explorer crash on me a few times. Pretty silly.

Then again, I have not reinstalled Windows because the only reason I still have it because it is pre-installed on the devices. I hardly use it and if I planned to remove a legit copy I’d probably not even bother reinstalling it. So you may blame it on other third-party vendors installing crap, although I’m pretty sure I removed it all - never even activated the virus scanner. (And no, it doesn’t have a virus)[/quote]Good thing the majority of people don’t have these issues then right?

Read full topic

item.title: Considering a New Distro
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

My experiences with Windows 7 are pretty horrible. Granted, I don’t use it often - but I still have it installed on some of my machines. Whenever I fire it up - it really lives up to its reputation. Constantly the mouse icon switches from the regular pointer icon to the ``waiting/busy’’ pointer icon, explorer takes seconds to fire up and the system is generally quite sluggish. No, my machines aren’t old. It also uses a lot of memory. And I’ve also had explorer crash on me a few times. Pretty silly.

Then again, I have not reinstalled Windows because the only reason I still have it because it is pre-installed on the devices. I hardly use it and if I planned to remove a legit copy I’d probably not even bother reinstalling it. So you may blame it on other third-party vendors installing crap, although I’m pretty sure I removed it all - never even activated the virus scanner. (And no, it doesn’t have a virus)

Read full topic

item.title: Considering a New Distro
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:19, topic:415136”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=517094.msg3767838#msg3767838 date=1317408681]
Windows 7 is a great operating system, and probably one of the best things Microsoft has ever made… It far surpasses what Windows XP ever was.
[/quote]

I’ve used both, Windows XP more obviously, but I don’t see anything in Windows 7 that is better than Windows XP besides support for newer hardware, which of course could have been integrated in XP as well. Can you tell me why you think it surpasses XP?[/quote]Proper memory caching for one.

Read full topic

item.title: Considering a New Distro
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

eczema3:

Windows 7 is a great operating system, and probably one of the best things Microsoft has ever made… It far surpasses what Windows XP ever was.

I’ve used both, Windows XP more obviously, but I don’t see anything in Windows 7 that is better than Windows XP besides support for newer hardware, which of course could have been integrated in XP as well. Can you tell me why you think it surpasses XP?

Read full topic
